statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Montana State 83, Northern Colorado 69
article.story: GREELEY, Colo. (AP) -- Marvin Moss scored 16 points and Branden Miller and Ja'Ron Jefferson added 15 points each as Montana State rallied past Northern Colorado 83-69 Thursday night. Carson Durr had three 3-pointers and 10 points in the second half for Montana State (2-3) of the Big Sky Conference. The Bobcats shot 54 percent from the field and were 6-of-11 on 3-pointers in the second half. Michael Gordy scored 17 points, Kirk Archibeque had 14 points and Sean Taibi added 11 points for Northern Colorado (0-7), an independent that will join the Big Sky Conference next year. The Bears hurt themselves by shooting 16-for-29 from the free throw line. They opened the season with seven losses for the first time since the 1954-55 season. Trailing by three midway through the second half, Durr hit consecutive 3-pointers to put Montana State ahead 62-59. While Northern Colorado managed only a free throw by Gordy over the next three minutes, Miller had two jumpers in an 8-1 run, and the Bobcats extended their lead to 70-60 with 6:29 left. Durr's third 3-pointer of the half extended the lead to 73-62. Taibi got the Bears as close as 77-69 with a jumper and free throw with 1:51 left, but they never scored again. Archibeque had 10 points and Northern Colorado shot 52 percent from the field to take a 38-35 lead at halftime. Northern Colorado hasn't beaten a Big Sky team since Dec. 2, 1977.
